result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Codie J Bundy

records.addlTxt:
11:12 AM Defendant Codie J Bundy in court without counsel.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - moves to quash warrant and schedule return date
Court - warrant quashed and schedules return date - deft is to notify COC office of updated address
Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on January 3, 2023 at 03:30 pm.

8:35 AM Defendant Codie J Bundy not in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Codie J Bundy.  Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin. A. Standaert - Clerk 

Atty Rivard - no information on deft's whereabouts
Court - speaks to case history
State - asks for bench warrant
Atty Rivard - asks to hold warrant
Court - issues bench warrant

11:04 AM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Codie J Bundy in court.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Codie J Bundy. A. Standaert - Clerk 

Atty Rivard - rec'd information, waives further reading, enters NG plea on each count
Court - receives pleas
Atty Rivard - have not received discovery
State - file indicates that discovery is ready to be picked up
Court - schedules return date
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Megan E. Kelly in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Codie J Bundy in court, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Codie J Bundy. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - calls Officer Abigail Wood who is sworn in and testifies
Officer Wood identifies deft
Atty Rivard - cross-examination of Officer Wood
State - redirect of Officer Wood
Officer Wood is excused
State - asks Court to find probable cause and bind deft over for arraignment
Atty Rivard - no argument
Court - finds probable cause and binds deft over for arraignment

Atty Rivard - speaks to cash bond, deft has a funeral he would like to attend, asks for sign bond
State - objects to modification of bond, notes deft must wait 72 hours after bond is set to request modification of bond
Court - modifies bond to $200 sign bond with same conditions
Arraignment scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.
no drugs without valid prescription, no possession of drug paraphernalia

1:16 PM Prosecuting attorney Andrew John Maki in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Codie J Bundy appeared by video, in custody from the Dunn County Jail.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen appeared by video for Codie J Bundy. A. Standaert - Clerk 

State - asking for $200 cash bond
Atty Lundeen - asking for high sign bond
Court - orders $200 cash bond - no drugs without valid prescription, no possession of drug paraphernalia

INIT
Atty Lundeen - waives reading and requests speedy prelim
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 22, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
